newsitem.title: USA: Valero says Mexico MTBE project off.
newsitem.headline: Valero says Mexico MTBE project off.

text.p: Valero Energy Corp's long-postponed $450 million project to produce the gasoline additive MTBE in Mexico appears to have fallen through, Valero spokesman Keith Booke said Tuesday .
The company said in a statement in January that the project was in danger.
"And that is the case. It's pretty much off," Booke told Reuters.

The project -- a plant to produce 17,000 barrels of MTBE daily -- was put on hold first because of the Mexican economic crisis that followed the 1994 peso devaluation and later because of difficulties getting financing.
MTBE, or methyl tertiary butyl ether, is an additive that makes gasoline burn cleaner and raises octane.

Valero wrote off its $19.5 million investment in the project in the fourth quarter of 1996, but Chairman Bill Greehey told Reuters in January that a major Mexican company had asked Valero to take another look at the plan with the idea of doing a joint deal.
"Nothing ended up materializing there," Brooke said.
